Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> The main goal of `init_iguana.py` is to get rid of all the bash wrappers in the standard method. Replace them with a single, clear, python script. Decoupling thus the building process from the initialization process.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> So it's not just about making the operation easier, but also making the current code base better.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> Kind of two convergent yet distinct different goals.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Thing is i won t personnaly change bash scripting unless am forced to. I don t see the need of adding a layer with python for something that already works flawlessly

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: When we ll have to it will be different. Am very lazy : i see things a different way : the tech and bottlenecks create the need for adaptation. The adaptation is here to follow or serve the needs. Not the opposite. But am a dinosaur lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> I see.
The problem with the current architecture (i'm talking about the operational codebase, not iguana itself), is that it wasn't designed to scale, but to just work. If it works, every time, with one click, then it's OK.
Now, if we want to scale, that approach is no longer valid, and we need to be prepared. Putting each part of the process in its own space (module) is crucial to achieve scaling.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Even with 1k chains it is valid. Not "fashion" but no risk at all relying on it.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: And before we have this scaling problem we ll have to figure out other things and possibly change the way architecture is done atm.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: No problem until there is one :D

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[matrix] <mylo5ha5:matrix.org> When you say ‚Äòscale‚Äô what do you mean?

If it‚Äôs something like autochains from section 3.1 of the verus vision paper (p7 of http://185.25.51.16/papers/VerusVision.pdf). Then there is mention of a provisioning protocol on page 8 do there is Blockchain based ‚Äúspawning‚Äù it reads.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> Scale, i mean, having more than 5000 assetchains to notarize.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> And having to expand to a multi-host setup, each notary node.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> In any case, having a clear division between every operational stage is good and desirable, in my opinion. One thing is the core (iguana and komodod binaries), another thing is initialization, another thing is daemon handling, another thing is utxo handling, etc.
Today it's all mixed up; it works, I know, but it is not ideal.
